result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio L Bocardo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by attorney Masana

Defendant Julio L Bocardo in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CM373 and 16CM68.  Rights/Elements.  In 16CM68 Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to pay $1183.00 fines/costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Submit DNA sample.  16CM373 Dismissed. No jail credit.

Court called 9:19/9:21 AM. Defendant, Julio L Bocardo, appeared. Petiton is reviewed. Court finds def indigent and appoints Atty Peter Masana. Defendant to pay $80/mo starting 5-1-16.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 08:40 am.  Return date scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant, Julio L Bocardo, appeared in custody with Atty. Tristan Eagon, special for today. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,000 recog. bond with no contact R.P., her residence or workplace. May return one time with officer to get personal belongings. Not possess/consume alcohol.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 11:10 am.  Return date scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
